db:abstract.db:para: An interface for flash related camera settings.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: This type allows you to operate the camera flash hardware and control the flash mode used. Not all cameras have flash hardware (and in some cases it is shared with the torch hardware).
It should not be constructed separately, instead the flash property of a Camera should be used.

db:section.db:title: mode : enumeration
db:section.db:para: This property holds the camera flash mode.
The mode can be one of the following:

db:td.db:para: Constant light source. If supported, torch can be enabled without loading the camera.
Constant light source, useful for video capture. The light is turned on only while the camera is active.
Use the flash in conjunction with a slow shutter speed. This mode allows better exposure of distant objects and/or motion blur effect.
The similar mode to FlashSlowSyncFrontCurtain but flash is fired at the end of exposure.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] ready : bool
db:section.db:para: This property indicates whether the flash is charged.

db:section.db:title: flashModeChanged(int)
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted when the flashMode property is changed. The corresponding handler is onFlashModeChanged.

db:section.db:title: flashReady(bool)
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted when QCameraExposure indicates that the flash is ready to use. The corresponding handler is onFlashReadyChanged.
